definition[0]: a time when shares in a company are made available for people to buy for the first time
example[0]: The company has decided to postpone its flotation on the stock market.
definition[1]: making shares in a company available for people to buy for the first time
example[1]: The group has decided to postpone its stockmarket flotation until next year.
example[2]: If the dividend had been cut, it might have made investors nervous about the forthcoming share flotation.
